data.title: Usher's dating history: Everything we know about his relationships
data.meta_description:
Over the years, Usher, 45, has dated stars, been married twice, and is a father to four.
But now, the Yeah!...
data.text:
The DJ got Usher falling in love again.

Just hours after he performed the 2024 Super Bowl half-time show, Usher Raymond IV tied the knot with Jennifer Goicoechea, the mother of his youngest two children.

Over the years, Usher, 45, has dated other stars, been married twice, and is a father to four.

Now, the singing sensation has settled down again, with his representatives confirming on Tuesday (AEDT) the couple got married in Las Vegas (as had been rumoured), walking down the aisle just hours after the Yeah! singer performed at Allegiant Stadium.

AS IT HAPPENED: Taylor Swift's night out at the Super Bowl as it unfolds

"We can confirm that Usher and Jennifer Goicoechea took the next step in their relationship and did get married on Sunday night in Las Vegas surrounded by close friends and family," the singer's reps confirmed to People magazine.

"They both look forward to continuing to raise their children together surrounded by love and thank everyone for the well wishes."

The newlyweds exchanged "I dos" at the intimate outdoor wedding chapel Terrace Gazebo, with Usher's mum reportedly the witness for the couple's nuptials.

After the wedding, the pair hit up the Super Bowl after party that doubled as a release party for the singer's new album, Coming Home , at which Usher happily showed off his wedding band alongside his own Super Bowl ring.

It had earlier been reported by People that the pair had obtained a marriage licence three days before the nuptials, so it wasn't a snap decision.

"Listen, when you find someone that you know is a great partner, of course it is an honour and a pleasure to be able to share life with someone who wants to share it with you and loves you, who you are," he told the publication previously.

"We've obviously made a commitment to life for life together because of our children."

"It wouldn't be odd for us to get married. We already did here. You know what I'm saying?"

Read on to find out all about the star's new, and past, relationships.

READ MORE: All the details from Usher's Super Bowl half-time show including his slew of special guests

Chilli Thomas (2001 to 2004)

Usher's first high profile relationship was with TLC star Rozonda 'Chilli' Thomas.

The R&B couple first met in 1993 after they were signed to the same recording label, but didn't start a romantic relationship until years later in 2001.

The pair dated for a few years until eventually calling it quits in 2004.

Shortly after their breakup, Usher released his hit album Confessions, which many believed to be about his relationship with Thomas amid speculation he cheated.

However, the TLC singer put these rumours to rest in a 2013 interview with Us Weekly.

READ MORE: How one phone call to school can save parents big bucks

"All of those songs on Confessions, that was about Jermaine Dupri's situation. Usher was just singing it," Thomas said, adding she was in the studio when album was made.

"But people kind of bought into it, it was just the timing of our breakup when the album came out," she said. "So people assumed that album was about us, but it was not,"

Speaking to People in 2023, Thomas reflected on her "chemistry" with Usher in the '00s.

For a daily dose of 9Honey, subscribe to our newsletter here

Most controversial Super Bowl half-time show moments

"We definitely had some chemistry," she said.

"But working chemistry does not mean it works in your personal life. If we were working, it was great. But outside of that, we're so different."

According to People, the pair ultimately ended their on-off relationship due to "differing values and trust issues ."

Tameka Foster (2005 to 2009)

Usher was married to fashion designer Tameka Foster for two years from 2007 to 2009, after they reportedly began dating in late 2005.

Before starting a relationship with the R&B star, Foster was already divorced and a mother to three.

"He just accepted me for who I am. I have flaws, I have an attitude problem," the stylist told Essence.com ahead of her wedding to Usher.

READ MORE: Game-changing move could help slash your grocery costs

"Overall, I have issues that a person could either love or hate, but he accepted me completely. And every day he still treats me like we just met."

The pair welcomed their first child, Usher "Cinco" V in November 2007. They later had a second son Naviyd Ely in December 2008.

Usher and Foster had a short marriage, divorcing in 2009.

Recently, TMZ claimed that the R&B singer is reportedly planning to sell his mansion that his ex-wife has lived in for the past few years.

All the celebrities spotted at the 2024 Super Bowl

Grace Miguel (2009 to 2018)

Not long after his marriage ended, Usher began a relationship with Grace Miguel, who would become his manager as well.

"I have an incredible partner and manager," Usher told Billboard in 2014.

"She has helped me through some of the hardest times in my life and my career."

"She's someone who's been able to support and understand all of who I am," he said.

The couple secretly tied the knot in late 2015 and were married for three years before sadly calling it quits in 2018.

READ MORE: The budget 'mistake' most families make and how to fix it

The pair confirmed they had separated in March 2018 with a joint statement shared to US media outlets.

"After much thought and consideration, we have mutually decided to separate as a couple," the pair said.

"We remain deeply connected, loving friends who will continue supporting each other through the next phases of our lives," the statement continued.

"The enormous amount of love and respect that we have for each other will only increase as we move forward."

Usher officially filed fo r divorce nine months later.

READ MORE: Why Charles and Harry only met for 30 minutes

Jennifer Goicoechea (2019 to now)

Usher is currently in a relationship with Jennifer Goicoechea.

The pair first sparked romance rumours in 2019, and just a year later, they were expecting their first child together.

In September 2020, Usher announced the couple had welcomed their first daughter, Sovereign Bo.

"We are feeling blessed and full of love with the arrival of our beautiful baby girl, Sovereign Bo Raymond. "Isn't She lovely" by Stevie Wonder on repeat ❤️ ❤️ ❤️," he wrote to Instagram.

In 2021, Usher and Goicoechea subtly confirmed they were expecting their second child, showing off the music executive's baby bump at the 2021 iHeartRadio Music Awards.

In October, Usher announced the birth of their son – his fourth child – to Instagram.

" Hi my name is Sire Castrello Raymond … I am the newest addition to the Raymond crew," the R&B star wrote.

The couple tied the knot in a small ceremony after Usher's Super Bowl Half-Time show on February 11, 2024 in Las Vegas.
